metadata.title: Epigenetic Dynamics Optimization Algorithm and Its Mechanism Study
metadata.description: Epigenetics is the study of gene expression regulation and phenotypic shaping. Its core characteristic is the dynamic regulation of gene expression without altering the gene sequence. Key epigenetic mechanisms include DNA methylation, histone modification, noncoding RNA regulation, and chromatin remodeling. These mechanisms are reversible, heritable, multi-layered, dynamic, and environmentally adaptable. Inspired by the principles of epigenetics, this paper proposes a novel heuristic optimization algorithm, Epigenetic Dynamics Optimization (EDO). Building on the core properties of epigenetics, this algorithm incorporates the reversible methylation dynamics mechanism (RMD), the multi-layered histone energy mechanism (MHE), the noncoding RNA cooperative network (NCN), and the chromatin topology remodeling mechanism (CTR), enabling individual activity control, local search optimization, global hopping, and coordinated transfer of neighborhood information. This paper provides a detailed explanation of the algorithmic mechanism, mathematical formula derivation, and optimization strategy design, providing a theoretical foundation for future research on epigenetic heuristic optimization algorithms.

metadata.title: Supporting data for RCANE: A Deep Learning Algorithm for Whole-genome Pan-Cancer Somatic Copy Number Aberration Prediction using RNA-seq Data.
metadata.description: This is the data repository for RCANE: A Deep Learning Algorithm for Whole-genome Pan-Cancer Somatic Copy Number Aberration Prediction using RNA-seq Data. To use this dataset, please refer to https://github.com/HowardGech/RCANE.

metadata.title: PD5D_MTG_snRNAseq
metadata.description:
This Zenodo deposit contains a publicly available description of the Dataset:

Title: "PD5D_MTG_snRNAseq".

Description: This dataset contains single-nucleus RNA sequencing (snRNAseq) raw data in FASTQ format for 94 human middle temporal gyrus (MTG) samples from Parkinson's patients and healthy controls. It's part of the PD5D atlas, where the same subjects were also profiled with other omics assays incl. genotyping, single-cell ATACseq, and spatial transcriptomics.

This dataset is made available to researchers via the ASAP CRN Cloud: cloud.parkinsonsroadmap.org. Instructions for how to request access can be found in the User Manual.

This research was funded by the Aligning Science Across Parkinson's Collaborative Research Network (ASAP CRN), through the Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson's Research (MJFF).

This Zenodo deposit was created by the ASAP CRN Cloud staff on behalf of the dataset authors. It provides a citable reference for a CRN Cloud Dataset

Dataset Metadata was updated for the v1.1 update
references: Aligning Science Across Parkinson's Collaborative Research Network Cloud, https://cloud.parkinsonsroadmap.org/collections, RRID:SCR_023923
Team Scherzer

grants.title: Parkinson5D: deconstructing proximal disease mechanisms across cells, space, and progression

metadata.title: PD5D_MTG_snRNAseq_hybsel
metadata.description:
This Zenodo deposit contains a publicly available description of the Dataset:

Title: "PD5D_MTG_snRNAseq_hybsel".

Description: This dataset contains the raw data in FASTQ format for single-nucleus RNA sequencing (snRNAseq) enriched with Agilent SureSelect for reads from a list of targeted transcripts for human middle temporal gyrus (MTG) samples from Parkinson's patients and healthy controls. This data comes from the same 10X libraries as PD5D_MTG_snRNAseq, except with the additional enrichment step before sequencing. It's part of the PD5D cohort, where the same subjects were also profiled with other omics assays incl. genotyping, single-cell ATACseq, and spatial transcriptomics.

This dataset is made available to researchers via the ASAP CRN Cloud: cloud.parkinsonsroadmap.org. Instructions for how to request access can be found in the User Manual.

This research was funded by the Aligning Science Across Parkinson's Collaborative Research Network (ASAP CRN), through the Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson's Research (MJFF).

This Zenodo deposit was created by the ASAP CRN Cloud staff on behalf of the dataset authors. It provides a citable reference for a CRN Cloud Dataset

Dataset Metadata was updated for the v1.1 update
references: Aligning Science Across Parkinson's Collaborative Research Network Cloud, https://cloud.parkinsonsroadmap.org/collections, RRID:SCR_023923
Team Scherzer

metadata.title: snRNAseq of olfactory epithelium with AAV serotypes for transduction of olfactory sensory neurons in Mus musculus
metadata.description:
This Zenodo deposit contains a publicly available description of the Dataset:

Title: "snRNAseq of olfactory epithelium with AAV serotypes for transduction of olfactory sensory neurons in Mus musculus".

Description: Single-nucleus RNA sequencing data of 4 mice, each inoculated with 4 AAV serotypes. The mice were all male and 8-10 weeks of age at when olfactory epithelium tissue was harvested. Samples were paired-end sequences using v3.1 – Dual Index using Illumina Novaseq 6000 sequencer.

This dataset is made available to researchers via the ASAP CRN Cloud: cloud.parkinsonsroadmap.org. Instructions for how to request access can be found in the User Manual.

This research was funded by the Aligning Science Across Parkinson's Collaborative Research Network (ASAP CRN), through the Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson's Research (MJFF).

This Zenodo deposit was created by the ASAP CRN Cloud staff on behalf of the dataset authors. It provides a citable reference for a CRN Cloud Dataset

metadata.title: Nanoparticle delivery of CRISPR based gene-therapy into the human brain
metadata.description:
Neurological diseases such as amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), Alzheimer’s disease (AD), and frontotemporal dementia (FTD) share numerous pathological and molecular characteristics. These attributes include the accumulation of proteins such as TDP-43, amyloid and tau, a gradual acceleration in neuronal cell-death and progressive neurodegeneration. A particularly notable commonality among these pathologies, lies within their genetic signatures. Beyond monogenic and polygenic risk factors, such as the APOE4 allele and MAPT gene-variants, repeat expansions like those found in C9orf72 and HTT, manifest a common feat of neurodegenerative diseases. Unfortunately, in spite of the deep and detailed genetic descriptions of these neurological pathologies, cures do not exist, and effective therapies remain limited.

CRISPR-based gene therapy offers promising solutions to these genetic challenges; but successful delivery of genome-editing tools into target-cells remains a significant challenge in the field of molecular medicine. Numerous modalities are being explored; including lipid nanoparticles (LNPs), virus-like particles (VLPs), and peptide-conjugated ribonucleoprotein complexes (RNPs); each with distinct advantages and limitations. In this study we report the development of a high-throughput screening platform, based on a bi-fluorescent human induced neuron reporter-cell. The system combines both visual and sequencing data, to enable temporal and visual monitoring of genome-editing outcomes over time. Using this platform, we present highly efficient genome editing in human neurons, using engineered nanoparticles on the basis of HIV-1. These results highlight the advantages of image based screening methods for CRISPR-delivery, and underwrite the importance of scalable nanoparticle discovery platforms in the quest for cures.

metadata.title: Hybrid untargeted and targeted RNA sequencing facilitates genotype-phenotype associations at  single-cell resolution
metadata.description:
Expression count tables:

  • lr_wta.rds: LR-WTA count table based on its cell calling.
  • sr_wta.rds: SR-WTA count table based on its cell calling.
  • lr_wta_allcell.rds: LR-WTA count table based on the cell calling of SR-WTA.
  • lr_twist.rds: LR-Twist count table based on cell calling of SR-WTA.

metadata.title: Data for the electronic pituitary omics platform
metadata.description:
This repository contains all data related to the electronic pituitary omics database and the Consensus Pituitary Atlas.

epitome platform files:

data.tar.gz  - contains all non sc data to run the website
sc_data.tar.gz - contains some rna datasets sufficient to run the website
sc_atac_data.tar.gz - contains some atac datasets sufficient to run the website
 
CPA files:
atac_all_cells.h5ad - contains all ATAC cells
rna_non_wt_cells.h5ad - contains all non-wt/non-ctrl cells with RNA data
wt_adata_merged_post_scvi_0902.h5ad - contains all wt/ctrl cells with RNA data

With each version of the database, the underlying data will be updated and pushed here.

If the website every fails to be maintained on our end, this is a potential way for the community to restore the data without it being lost. In principle, using the published code and this data repository, one could re-host the website anytime.

For citation, please do not cite this repository (unless there is a very good reason) - rather cite the source publication or the epitome Zenodo code repository.

creators.name: Kӧvér, Bence
creators.affiliation: King's College London
